metadata.title: CVE-2020-7247 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
smtp_mailaddr in smtp_session.c in OpenSMTPD 6.6, as used in OpenBSD 6.6and other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commandsas root via a crafted SMTP session, as demonstrated by shell metacharactersin a MAIL FROM field. This affects the "uncommented" default configuration.The issue exists because of an incorrect return value upon failure of inputvalidation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

opensmtpd - 5.7.3p2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opensmtpd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3p2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
